description:
Manages an offset time resource, which keeps an UTC timestamp stored in the Terraform state that is offset from a locally sourced base timestamp. This prevents perpetual differences caused by using the [`timestamp()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/timestamp.html).

-> Further manipulation of incoming or outgoing values can be accomplished with the [`formatdate()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/formatdate.html) and the [`timeadd()` function](https://www.terraform.io/docs/configuration/functions/timeadd.html).

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

BaseRfc3339.description: Configure the base timestamp with an UTC [RFC3339 time string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) (`YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

OffsetDays.description: Number of days to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

OffsetHours.description: Number of hours to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

OffsetMinutes.description: Number of minutes to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

OffsetMonths.description: Number of months to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

OffsetSeconds.description: Number of seconds to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

OffsetYears.description: Number of years to offset the base timestamp. Conflicts with other `offset_` arguments.

Triggers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. See [the main provider documentation](../index.html) for more information.
